quotes:
In office
18 July 2016 – 15 July 2022

In office
6 September 2013 – 18 July 2016

In office
December 1, 2006 – December 1, 2012
Patricia Espinosa Cantellano (born October 21, 1958) is a Mexican diplomat who served as the executive secretary of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change from 2016 to 2022.
Ambassador Cantellano has served as responsible for economic affairs, Permanent Mission of Mexico to UN, Geneva (1982-88);
Head, Cabinet to Undersecretary of Foreign Affairs (1989-91);
Director of International Organizations (1991-93);
Espinosa Cantellano joined the Foreign Service on September 16, 1981.

Born
Patricia Espinosa Cantellano
(
1958-10-21
)
of Mexico to UN, New York (1993-97)
President of the Third Committee, UN General Assembly (1996-97)

General Director of Regional Organizations of the Americas, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Coordinator for Rio Group, Iberoamerican Summit, Summit of Americas and Summit of Latin America and Caribbean with European Union (1997-99)
She was promoted to Ambassador within the Foreign Service in 2000
served at the Mexican Embassy in Germany from January 2001 to June 2002
Ambassador to Austria, concurrently with a number of international organizations based in Vienna, from 2002 to 2006
On November 28, 2006, President-elect Felipe Calderón announced that she would serve as his Secretary of Foreign Affairs starting on December 1, 2006
On November 28, 2006, President-elect Felipe Calderón announced that she would serve as his Secretary of Foreign Affairs starting on December 1, 2006
Organized the first-ever G-20 Summit in an emergency country (2012)

Conducted the 16th United Nations Climate Change Conference (COP16) to successfully adopt the 'Cancun Agreements', reinstating credibility and trust in multilateral process after the failed conference in Copenhagen (2009)
Because of her outstanding career as a Mexican diplomat, she was appointed Ambassador Emeritus of Mexico in 2012
From 2012 to 2016, she was again Ambassador of Mexico to Germany
In May 2016, Espinosa was selected by United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon to be the Executive Secretary of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
Secretary of Foreign Affairs 1 December 2006–December 2012
